attributes.comment:
USCIS-2006-0044 : I am in shock that USCIS feels it is a fee increase is needed,
when their service remains one of the most frustrating part of the entire
international adoption process! The service many receive is beyond poor,
inadquate, substandard, rude, and many more adjectives come to mind. To top it
off, the laws are poorly written, confusing and not followed by other government
agencies. Two of my children are adopted internationally, but because their
country sends them to us on a guardianship and we then finalize their adoptions
here 6 months later (South Korea and Hong Kong) we did not automatically
receive their CoC for free, like children adopted from Russia, China, etc. We have
to file, fill out endless forms, pay fees, pictures and even attend interviews like
adult immigrants. Even though our laws state their are immediately a U.S. Citizen
as soon as they are adopted by U.S. Citizens.

I am disgusted that the crappy service we receive from the USCIS thinks they
deserve more money for such poor service.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Victoria L. LaLonde
